metadata.Title: CVE-2018-10928 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in RPC request using gfs3_symlink_req in glusterfs serverwhich allows symlink destinations to point to file paths outside of thegluster volume. An authenticated attacker could use this flaw to createarbitrary symlinks pointing anywhere on the server and execute arbitrarycode on glusterfs server nodes.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10928` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

glusterfs-client - 3.7.6-1ubuntu1+esm1
glusterfs-common - 3.7.6-1ubuntu1+esm1
glusterfs-server - 3.7.6-1ubuntu1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: glusterfs package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.7.6-1ubuntu1+esm1').
